text:
Is there a reason why Julia can't find the custom methods I define for `mul!` in my package here: <https://github.com/bonevbs/HssMatrices.jl/blob/main/src/HssMatrices.jl> ?
I did the obligatory `import LinearAlgebra: mul!`  but when I call it with
```@which mul!(@view(y[1:100,:]), A, @view(x[1:100,:]), 1., 0.)```
I get
```julia> @which mul!(@view(y[1:100,:]), A, @view(x[1:100,:]), 1., 0.)
mul!(C::AbstractArray{T,2} where T, A::Union{AbstractArray{T,1}, AbstractArray{T,2}} where T, B::Union{AbstractArray{T,1}, AbstractArray{T,2}} where T, alpha::Number, beta::Number) in LinearAlgebra at /Applications/Julia-1.5.app/Contents/Resources/julia/share/julia/stdlib/v1.5/LinearAlgebra/src/matmul.jl:235```

elements.text: Is there a reason why Julia can't find the custom methods I define for
but when I call it with

julia> @which mul!(@view(y[1:100,:]), A, @view(x[1:100,:]), 1., 0.)
